Email Twitter LinkedIn Scholar

Hi, Iâ€™m a Research Scholar at NEC Labs, Media Analytics department. My interests lie in the field of vision, learning and robotics. Currently, my work has been focused on diverse and multi-agent motion forecasting.

Prior to joining NEC, I worked as a Research Assistant at Robotics Research Center under the guidance of Prof. K. Madhava Krishna in problems related to perception and prediction for autonomous vehicles. Also, I was extremely fortunate to collaborate with Dr. Vineet Gandhi during my time at IIIT Hyderabad. I spent my Summer 2017 at IIIT Delhi under mentorship of Dr. Sanjit Kaul in realizing my dream to make a self-driving vehicle.

News

07/20: Paper SMART: Simultaneous Multi-Agent Recurrent Trajectory Prediction is accepted at ECCV 20
11/19: Served as a reviewer for ICRA 2020.
07/19: Joined NEC Labs America as a Research Scholar.
06/19: Work on language conditioned autonomous navigation is accepted at IROS 19.
04/19: Work on diverse trajectory proposals for outdoor scenes is accepted at IV 19.
04/19: Work on shrinking domain based control for planning is accepted at AIR 19.
